explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is -54degC (c.c.) (ICSC, 2004) and the boiling point is 34degC, which is classified into Category 1. Those containing stabilizers are classified into Class 3 and Packing Group I (UN#1218) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though containing unsaturated bonds. Those containing stabilizers are classified into Class 3 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#1218)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 220degC (ICSC, 2004)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to gaseous substances are not available - boiling point: 34degC (ICSC, 2004), test temperature: 55degC

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 2,043mg/kg (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.45 (2005)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (4 hour inhalation of vapour) value of 63,600ppm (180mg/L) (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.45 (2005) was lower than 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (530,000ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 53.2kPa (20degC) (ICSC, 2004), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "mild irritation" from tests on human volunteers (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.45 (2005)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "mild irritation" from tests on human volunteers (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.45 (2005)).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: No data available

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, positive data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests) and the absence of data on germ cell genotoxicity tests in vivo, described in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.45 (2005).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category R by NTP (2005) and Group 2B by IARC (1999).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Because of the absence of data on reproductive toxicity; the results of rat developmental toxicity tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.45 (2005)) suggest a very low or negligible effect on the embryo (body weight reduction, delayed ossification, etc.).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "adverse effects on the central nervous system, dyspnea, lowering of consciousness, burning sensation, cough, dizziness, smothering feeling, nausea, breathlessness, pharyngalgia" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 1 (2002)). Respiratory irritation, suppression of the central nervous system and narcotic effects are observed.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (respiratory organs, nervous system) Category 2 (liver, blood system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on human evidence including "catarrhal inflammation, atrophic degeneration of the upper respiratory tract, a reduced sense of smell, delay in the reflex latency, a decrease in blood pressure" (CERI Hazard Data 97-5 (2002)), and the evidence from animal studies including "hepatocellular vacuolar degeneration, a decrease in red blood cell count, low hemoglobin concentrations," "macrocytic anemia," "spinal degeneration" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.45 (2005)). The effects on "nervous systems" and "liver and blood systems" are observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1 and Category 2, respectively.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48 hours EC50=3.2mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals, 2000).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 2 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (BCF=20(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 2%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 2.
